iplb_frontends_intro_text: The front-end is the part of your Load Balancer that makes your services visible on the internet.
iplb_frontend_list_error: An error has occurred loading the list of front-ends.
iplb_frontend_update_error: An error has occurred modifying the following front-end: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_add_error: An error has occurred adding a front-end: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_add_port_tip: Ports presented by the front-end. 1 - {{portMax}}, format: basic (e.g.: 80), range (e.g.: 1,000-1,200), multi (e.g.: 80,443).
iplb_frontend_add_farm_text: Once this front-end has been created, you can add a server cluster to it directly by default.
iplb_frontend_add_default_certificate_te: You cannot add a new certificate directly. You can add it once you have finished creating your front-end.
iplb_frontend_add_advanced_options_info: The most recent default values are pre-set. You can modify them at any time.
iplb_frontend_add_dedicated_ip_failover_: List of IP addresses for remote servers connected to your Load Balancer.
iplb_frontend_add_restrict_ip_access_tip: List of customer IP addresses that have access to the Load Balancer (IPv4). Format: 1.2.3.4, 42.42.42.0/24 Format: 1.2.3.4, 42.42.42.0/24
iplb_frontend_add_hsts_tip: Activate HTTPS strict support, HTTP Strict Transport Security
iplb_frontend_delete_question: Are you sure you want to delete the {{frontend}} front-end?
iplb_frontend_delete_error: An error has occurred deleting the front-end: {{message}}
iplb_frontend_delete_success: The front-end has been successfully deleted.
iplb_frontend_toggle_error: An error has occurred editing the front-end: {{message}}
